intro: Hieracium congenitum, commonly known as the congenital hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and leafy basal rosettes. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with hairy stems and alternate, lance-shaped leaves. Its yellow flowers appear in clusters and bloom from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium congenitum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed sites, thriving in temperate climates.
